title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act is titled the "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" and amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a section for the 15th-anniversary review agreement. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with some exceptions related to federal programs and services. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, includes provisions for funding infrastructure maintenance and a fiscal consolidation fund in fiscal year 2013. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, includes provisions for funding infrastructure maintenance and a fiscal consolidation fund in fiscal year 2013. The amounts provided by the United States under the Agreement in fiscal years 2011 and 2012 will be shifted to fiscal years 2012 and 2013, with a reduction of $411,000 in 2012. Additionally, funding for infrastructure projects under the Agreement will be provided from 2012 to 2017. Congress consents to amendments in the Compact subsidiary agreements and authorizes appropriations for postal services. Additionally, a related law is amended by substituting '2024' for '2009'. Full faith and credit apply to commitments under the Compact Review Agreement, with oversight and reporting to appropriate Congressional committees. The Government of Palau is eligible for certain US domestic programs under the Compact. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources by March 1. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report by March 1 to the Senate and House committees on the use and effectiveness of assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs.
